info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 13 at 12:15AM EDT until July 13 at 3:15AM EDT by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following counties, Albemarle and Nelson.
* WHEN...Until 315 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1213 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in showers and embedded thunderstorms across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have already fallen with an additional 0.5 to 1 inch of rain possible. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Faber... Rockfish... Covesville... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
